info.title: GRUD API
info.description: a restful service for storing data in tables

post.description: Creates a new temporary file handle.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: file to add to the system

folder.description: parent folder id, if null parent folder is root folder

put.description: Uploads/replaces a language specific file for this file handle.

get.description: Returns the root folder. Has no ID because it can't be changed or deleted.

parameters.name: langtag
parameters.description: The langtag which specifies which language name filed should be used for sorting the files

get.description: Returns a specific folder. Hierarchy is not relevant.

parameters.name: langtag
parameters.description: The langtag which specifies which language name filed should be used for sorting the files

post.description: Resets whole schema and re-initialize system tables
Creates two demo tables (Bundesländer, Regierungsbezirke) with links.

post.summary: Create a complete table with columns and rows

get.description: Returns an array containing all available tables with their metadata.
Returns the metadata of a table.

delete.description: Drops the complete table and deletes its definition.

get.description: Returns all columns of specific table

post.description: Alters the user table and add the column definition to the system table.

200.description: The definition of the new column

get.description: Returns information about a specific column.

delete.description: Deletes column from user table and table definition.

get.description: Returns the value of a specified cell.

post.summary: DEPRECATED - Update cell or add link/attachment
post.description: DEPRECATED: Use same route with PATCH instead. Updates the value of specified cell. This can add links, attachments, multi-language contents and replaces simple values such as numbers, booleans or strings.

patch.description: Updates the value of specified cell. This can add links, attachments, multi-language contents and replaces simple values such as numbers, booleans or strings.

put.description: Replace the current value of the specified cell. This overwrites all languages in a multi-language cell or deletes all links and replaces the data with the provided value.

delete.description: Clears the set cell value and reset it to its default value.

get.description: Returns just the rows of the table

post.description: Adds new row to user table.

get.description: Returns a single row and its values.

post.description: Duplicates a row with the same values and returns the duplicated row.

get.description: Retrieve all rows of tables that link to this row.

patch.description: Adds new annotations to this row.

delete.description: Removes a specified attachment from a cell.

delete.summary: Delete a link in a cell
delete.description: Removes a link from a cell.

put.summary: Changes the order of the link.
put.description: Changes the order of the links by reordering the specified link to the beginning, end or in front of another relative link.

post.summary: Add an new annotation to a cell.
post.description: Adds an annotation to a cell. Annotations with the same type and value will be merged.

delete.summary: Remove an annotation from a cell.
delete.description: Removes an annotation for all language tags from a cell.

delete.summary: Remove annotation for a language from a cell.
delete.description: Removes an annotation for a specific language tag from a cell.

CellValue.description: New cell value, depending on the type of the column.

LanguageTag.description: A language tag in RFC 5646 format.

location.description: Sets the new order to be either the first (=start), the last (=end) or in front of another entity (=before).

id.description: If using "before", we need to provide the id of a relative entity, so the referenced entity can be put before this.

name.description: An internal name that can be used in the Aggregator, for example.

identifier.description: A setting whether this column shows up in the ID column (used to show important information in links).

multilanguage.description: If the values of the cells are translatable or not, this is set to true. You need to check the languageType setting, whether to check for language or for country specific values.

ordering.description: A value to put the column in the correct order in the table.

languageType.description: The language type of the column. It can be single language (see "multilanguage" property), multilanguage (language) or multicountry (country).

toTable.description: The table it links to, if the column is of kind "link".

countryCodes.description: The possible country values if the languageType is set to "country".

DependentRow.description: The complete row containing the values of the cells.

value.description: The value of the ID column linking here.

Response:CellAnnotation.description: TODO The annotation of a cell.

Response:Row.description: The complete row containing the values of the cells.

values.description: An array with all cells included. It is sorted by the current order of the columns of the table.

final.description: A flag describing whether the row is final or not.

Response:DependentRow.description: A row that links to a specified row.

final.description: A flag describing whether the row is final or not.

Response:DependentRows.description: All rows that link to the specified row.

dependentRows.description: An array with all rows depending on the selected row

Request:Folder.description: Creates a new folder. If parent is empty the folder will be created in the root folder.

Response: Folder.description: Complete folder with subfolders and files.

columns.description: Array of columns (kind 'link' is not allowed)

Request: Create complete table.description: Creates a new table with columns and rows. If columns & rows are empty an empty table will be created.

description.en: This table holds a list of all states of germany
description.de: diese Tabelle beinhaltet alle Bundesländer Deutschlands

Response: Complete table.description: Complete table with columns and rows.

current.description: The current version of the database

specification.description: The version of the implementation - if this is higher, you need to update the current database

Shared Response: Table.description: Complete table with columns and rows.

toTable.description: Optional, only needed if kind is link.

toColumn.description: Optional, only needed if kind is link.

Shared Response: Row.description: A row contains all column values of this specific table.

Shared Request: Row.description: A row object, which is used to add a new row to a table, has only an array of values.

Multi-language object.description: A multi-language object is a key-value object for multi-language values. Keys a langtags (e.g. de-DE) and the values are the value of that object in the specific language.

Response: Subfolder.description: A subfolder returned in a request to folders

identifier.description: Flag if this column should be part of the concatenated identifier column.

name.description: An internal name that can be used to easily identify tables instead of using an id.

frontendReadOnly.description: Flag if values of this column can be changed from frontend.

groups.description: A list of column ids that should build a group column

formatPattern.description: Pattern for the frontend how to render the content of a group column

Shared Request: Column.description: A column object, which is used to create a new column.

description.en: a group example, the column ids in groups array must be absolute

tableId.name: tableId
tableId.description: The id of the table to select.

columnId.name: columnId
columnId.description: The id of the column to select.

rowId.name: rowId
rowId.description: The id of the row to select.

attachmentId.name: attachmentId
attachmentId.description: The UUID of the attachment to select.

annotationId.name: annotationId
annotationId.description: The UUID of the annotation to select.

languageTag.name: languageTag
languageTag.description: A language tag in RFC 5646 format.

langtags.name: langtags
langtags.description: An array of language tags in RFC 5646 format.

linkId.name: linkId
linkId.description: The id of the linked entity to select.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the cell.

nonce.name: nonce
nonce.description: nonce which will be exposed via server log

dependentRows.description: A list of rows that depend on a selected row

not-found-in-database.description: If the specified entity does not exist in the database, this error is thrown. For example a table, column or row with the specified id could not be found.

no-json-found.description: Request should have had a JSON body.

invalid-json-exception.description: Request contains an invalid JSON body.

database-exception.description: Server got a PostgreSQL error while running a statement
